class data_gatherer.data_fetcher.APIClient(api_client, API, config, logger)

Class for fetching data from an API using the requests library.

download_xml(directory, api_data)

Downloads the XML data to a specified directory.

Parameters:

  • directory – The directory where the XML file will be saved.

  • api_data – The XML data to be saved.

fetch_data(article_url, retries=3, delay=2)

Fetches data from the API using the provided article URL.

Parameters:

article_url – The URL of the article to fetch data for.

class data_gatherer.data_fetcher.DataCompletenessChecker(config, logger, publisher='PMC')

Class to check the completeness of data sections in API responses.

extract_namespaces(xml_element)

Extract all namespaces in use, including xlink.

has_links_in_section(section, namespaces: dict[str, str]) → bool

Check if the given section contains any external links.

Parameters:

  • section – The section element to search for links.

  • namespaces – Namespaces to use for XML parsing.

Returns:

True if links are found, False otherwise.

has_target_section(raw_data, section_name: str) → bool

Check if the target section (data availability or supplementary data) exists in the raw data.

Parameters:

  • raw_data – Raw XML data.

  • section_name – Name of the section to check.

Returns:

True if the section is found with relevant links, False otherwise.

is_xml_data_complete(raw_data, url, required_sections=['data_availability', 'supplementary_data']) → bool

Check if required sections are present in the raw_data. Return True if all required sections are present.

Parameters:

  • raw_data – Raw XML data.

  • url – The URL of the article.

  • required_sections – List of required sections to check.

Returns:

True if all required sections are present, False otherwise.

class data_gatherer.data_fetcher.DataFetcher(config, logger, src='WebScraper')
update_DataFetcher_settings(url, entire_doc_model, logger, HTML_fallback=False)

Sets up either a web scraper or API client based on the URL domain. Also used to avoid re_instantiating another selenium webdriver.

Parameters:

  • url – The URL to fetch data from.

  • entire_doc_model – Flag to indicate if the entire document model is being used.

  • logger – The logger instance for logging messages.

  • HTML_fallback – Flag to indicate if HTML fallback is needed.

Returns:

An instance of the appropriate data fetcher (WebScraper or APIClient).

url_in_dataframe(url)

Checks if the given doi / pmcid is present in the DataFrame.

Parameters:

url – The URL to check.

Returns:

True if the URL is found, False otherwise.

class data_gatherer.data_fetcher.DatabaseFetcher(config, logger)

Class for fetching data from a DataFrame.

fetch_data(url_key, retries=3, delay=2)

Fetches data from a local file or database.

Parameters:

url_key – The key to identify the data in the database.

Returns:

The raw HTML content of the page.

class data_gatherer.data_fetcher.WebScraper(scraper_tool, config, logger)

Class for fetching data from web pages using Selenium.

download_file_from_url(url, output_root, paper_id)

Downloads a file from the given URL and saves it to the specified directory.

Parameters:

  • url – The URL to download the file from.

  • output_root – The root directory where the file will be saved.

  • paper_id – The ID of the paper, used to create a subdirectory.

download_html(dir)

Downloads the HTML content to a specified directory.

Parameters:

dir – The directory where the HTML file will be saved.

fetch_data(url, retries=3, delay=2)

Fetches data from the given URL, by simulating user scroll, waiting some delay time and doing multiple retries to allow for page load and then get the source html

Parameters:

  • url – The URL to fetch data from.

  • retries – Number of retries in case of failure.

  • delay – Delay time between retries.

Returns:

The raw HTML content of the page.

get_opendata_from_pubmed_id(pmid)

Given a PubMed ID, fetches the corresponding PMC ID and DOI from PubMed.

Parameters:

pmid – The PubMed ID to fetch data for.

Returns:

A tuple containing the PMC ID and DOI.

get_publication_name_from_driver()

Extracts the publication name from the WebDriver’s current page title. Remark: this should be called after scraper_tool.get(url) to ensure the page is loaded.

Returns:

The publication name as a string.

normalize_HTML(html, keep_tags=None)

Normalize the HTML content by removing unnecessary tags and attributes.

Parameters:

  • html – The raw HTML content to be normalized.

  • keep_tags – List of tags to keep in the HTML content. May be useful for some servers that host target info inside specific tags (e.g., <form> or <script>) that are otherwise removed by the scraper.

Returns:

The normalized HTML content.

normalize_links(links_raw_dict)

Convert Selenium WebElement objects to strings and keep existing string links unchanged.
